result.execSummary:
The defendant Armando Vazquez Vera was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
On Counts #1 and #2 of the Amended Information: The Court imposes 75 days in the county jail on each count concurrent, the Court stays this sentence and places Defendant on probation for 1 year.
Concurrent with:

miscConds.notes:
--no acts or threats of violence

--no possession or ingestion of alcohol

--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores

--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent

--continue in any recommended treatment or counseling

The Court orders that Probation and Parole allow Mr. Vera to travel to Mexico as required by Federal Immigration Law.

Arresting Agency: Jefferson PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Armando Vazquez Vera

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Reserve Judge Mac Davis presiding for Branch IV

Case called at 9:11am [mo]
Defendant Armando  Vazquez Vera in court with attorney Sylvie Helena Dahnert.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Shawna Stevenoski-- sworn as Spanish Interpreter

ADA Hall submits an Amended Information; the Court reviews maximum penalties of the Amended Information with Defendant
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " NO CONTEST " entered on Count #1 and Count #2 of the Amended Information; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
On Counts #1 and #2 of the Amended Information: The Court imposes 75 days in the county jail on each count concurrent, the Court stays this sentence and places Defendant on probation for 1 year, with conditions:

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--continue in any recommended treatment or counseling
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--to pay statutory costs 


The Court orders that Probation and Parole allow Mr. Vera to travel to Mexico as required by Federal Immigration Law

Days credit for time already served:  1  day
recess: 9:33am

Case called at 9:47 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Armando Vazquez Vera in court with Attorney Sylvie Helena Dahnert. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Shawna Stevenoski sworn as Spanish Interpreter.
Atty Dahnert submits letter to the Court  re: treatment
Atty Dahnert informs the Court that resolution of this case has been pending on completion of Mr. Vazquez Vera's treatment. Information of completion was given to DA Happ yesterday and she indicated that she did not have time to address and suggested to have the matter set for an additional DA PTC and STC
ADA Hall informs the Court that the notes in the file do indicate that, so do believe it is appropriate scheduling request
Court reminds mr. Vazquez Vera that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect
Recess: 9:48 am 

NEXT: (1) Schedule DA PTC 3/23/16 at 1:40 pm - Send notices (2) Schedule STC 4/8/16 at 9:00 am - Send notices

Case called at 10:11 am [Clerk SH] (On Defense Motion to Modify Bond)
Defendant Armando Vazquez Vera in court with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Shawna Stevenoski sworn as Spanish Interpreter. 
Upon questioning of the Court, ADA Hall indicates that the State does oppose motion

Amanda Velasquez--sworn & testfies
--direct exam by Atty Dahnert
--cross exam by ADA Hall
--redirect exam by Att Dahnert

Court presents basis and grants motion to modify bond and requires:

A $10,000 signature bond with conditions:
--No acts or threats of violence 
--No discussion of the facts of the case with Amanda Velasquez or Isabella Velasquez
--No contact with Isabella Velasquez
--Mr. Vasquez Vera is to continue to cooperate with treatment program

Court REMOVES the following conditions of bond:
--Mr. Vasquez Vera is to have no contact with Amanda Velasquez except for the purpose of counseling and for homework assignments and only if those homework assignments are supervised by the Counselor.
--Mr. Vasquez Vera may also have telephone or electronic communications (text, email or any way one can communicate electronically) with Amanda Velasquez for purposes of child placement, child's health or care but Child Placement must occur by way of a third party
--Mr. Vasquez Vera may return to the household accompanied by law enforcement to retrieve belongings, one time

Court informs Mr. Vazquez Vera of the possible consequences for bond violation
Court has colloquy with Miss Velasquez regarding safety of herself/children
Atty Dahnert requests STC date in late February; No objection from State - Court informs parties date will be sent out
Recess: 10:50 am 

NEXT: (1) Schedule STC in late February - Send notices
*Post-Hearing: Clerk received date of 2/26/16 at 9:30 am for STC from JA*

Case called at 1:50 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Armando  Vazquez Vera in court with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Shawna Stevenoski sworn as Spanish Interpreter.
Atty Dahnert submits notice of motion to modify bond; not asking for motion to be heard today. Have had numerous discussions - resolution of case depends on treatment and successful completion of treatment. Mr. Vera is in a 26 week program at this time. Draws Court's attention to letter attached to motion.
off-record: 1:52 - 1:53 pm for Court to review motion
Atty Dahnert: Would anticipate matter to resolve after treatment in February, but requests matter be set for motion hearing on a Monday or Tuesday
Court AMENDS Defendant's bond to ADD condition that Mr. Vera continue to cooperate with his treatment program
Recess: 1:57 pm

NEXT:  Schedule Motion Hearing 11/30/15 at 10:00 am - Send notices

Case called at 9:34 am [CLerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Armando Vazquez Vera in court with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Leisl Monroy sworn as Spanish Interpreter.
Atty Dahnert requests matter be set out 60 days, presents basis including that State's recommendation is pending on treatment. Def. just entered 26 week program. 
ADA Hall: Have had series of adjournments for treatment, are aware of waiting lists; no objection to adjournment
Court informs parties that It would like a check up in about 45 days to be sure Defendant is on track
Atty Dahnert orally motions to modify bond; requests the Court have colloquy with Miss Vazquez so she does not need to come back before filing of motion - 
Court denies interview today and indicates that she shall talk with Miss Happ in due course prior to motion
Court reminds Mr. Vazquez Vera that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect
Recess: 9:42 am 

NEXT: (1) Schedule STC 11/20/15 at 1:30 pm - Send notices

Case called at 10:51am [mo]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV]
Defendant Armando  Vazquez Vera in court with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Patrick Ryan--sworn as Spanish Interpreter

Atty. Dahnert indicates that Mr. Vera is scheduled to begin treatment; requests status out a couple months to allow completion of treatment
--the State does not object

The Court reminds Mr. Vera that his bond and its conditions remain in effect
recess:10:53

NEXT: Status Conference: 10/2/2015 at 9:00am

ADDRESS INFO for Armando Vazquez Vera
Current: 202 Adams St., Fort Atkinson, WI 53538 United States  (Effective: 07-06-2015)
Prior: 741 Wisconsin Dr, Jefferson, WI 53549

Case called at 11:08am 
Defendant Armando Vazquez Vera in court with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Shawna Stevenoski- sworn as Spanish Interpreter

Mr. Vazquez Vera waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment & Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--pleas of "not guilty" entered

Atty. Dahnert requests a PTC and Motion Hearing date, for Motion to Modify Bond
The Court reminds Mr. Vazquez Vera that his bond and its conditions remain in effect.
Atty. Dahnert is to submit the Motion to Modify Bond by 7/6/15.
recess:11:16am 

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 7/22/15 at 10:20am     (2) Status Conference on 7/31/15 at 10:30am (3) Motion Hearing to be arranged with JA (send notices)
The Court concludes the request is timely and in the proper form

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: to prepare amended bond & have Def. sign at 6/15/15 STC
Clerk's Note to Clerk re: Bond

Case called at 3:33pm [mo]
Defendant Armando Vazquez Vera in court with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.


Shawna Stevenoski---sworn as Spanish Interpreter

The Court discloses, under SCR 60.04 that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Armando Vazquez Vera. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.

On the State's 6/4/15 Motion to Modify Bond:
--The Defense opposes the Motion; gives arguments, further indicates that the information in the criminal complaint is incorrect and that there are witnesses present in the courtroom that are willing to testify.
---Arguments to Modify Bond by ADA Shock to include additonal condition: Mr. Vazquez Vera have no contact with Amanda Velasquez
--The Court and Counsel discuss the pending Rock Co. case and availability of Criminal Complaint
recess:3:43pm---reconvene:3:45pm (to allow the Court and Counsel to review the Rock Co. Criminal Complaint)

The Court reviews the Rock Co. Criminal Complaint with Counsel and Mr. Vazquez Vera 

Amanda Velasquez--sworn and testifies
--direct examination by Attorney Dahnert

The Court makes a finding that a child was not present in the vehicle at the time of the incident

The Court continues the already set $10,000.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No acts or threats of violence 
-No discuss the facts of the case with Amanda Velasquez or Isabella Velasquez

The Court orders the additional condition: 
--Mr. Vasquez Vera is to have no contact with Amanda Velasquez except for the purpose of counseling, in the presence of the Counselor.
--Mr. Vasquez Vera may also have electronic communications with Amanda Velasquez for purposes of child placement, child health (Child Placement must occur by way of a third party)
--Mr. Vasquez Vera may return to the houshold accompianed by law enforcement to retrieve his belongings, one time.
 
recess:4:25pm

NEXT: (1) Add Spanish Interpreter Need to Case
States motion to amend the bond
original bond document received from JESO on 6/3/15

Case called at 1:19 pm  [sf]
Defendant Armando Vazquez Vera in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Shawna Stevenoski sworn in as Spanish Interpreter.
Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Attorney Dahnert advises that she has been retained privately.
Court verifies DOB and address with defendant.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $10,000.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No acts or threats of violence 
-No discuss the facts of the case with Amanda Velasquez or Isabella Velasquez

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

Recess: 1:32 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
PTC: 6/24/15 at 10:00 am
Status: 7/14/15 at 8:30 am
Entered as Judge Koschnick in error, per Standing Order Corrected to Judge Wambach
